gurmukhi: ਅਾੲਿ ਨਾਰਦ ੲਿਮ ਸਿਵਹਿ ਜਤਾੲੀ ॥ ਕਹਾਂ ਬੈਠਿਹੋ ਭਾਂਗ ਚੜਾੲੀ ॥
transliteration: Aae Naarad Im Sivah(i0 Jagadee|| Kahaan Baithiho Bhaan Chadhaaee||
translation: Narad, on the other side, came to Shiva and said, “Why art thou sitting here, having been intoxicated with hemp (and there Guari hath burnt herself alive)?”

gurmukhi: ਛੁਟਯੋ ਧਯਾਨ ਕੋਪੁ ਜਿਯ ਜਾਗਾ ॥ ਗਹਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਸੂਲ ਤਿਹ ਕੋ ੳੁਠਿ ਭਾਗਾ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Chhoutyo Dhyaan Kip(u) Jiha Jaagad|| Gad(i) Trisool Tih Ko Ooth(i) Bhaagad||16||
translation: Hearing this, Shiva’s meditation was shattered and his heart was filled with rage; he held up his trident and ran towards that side.16.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਹੀ ਜਾਤ ਭਯੋ ਤਿਹ ਥਲੈ ॥ ਲਯੋ ੳੁਠਾੲਿ ਸੂਲ ਕਰ ਬਲੈ ॥
transliteration: Jab Hijaat Bhayo Tih Thalai|| Layo Outhaae Sool Kar Balai||
translation: When Shiva reached the place where Sati had burnt herself, he caught his trident also very firmly.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਤ ਭਾਂਤ ਤਿਨ ਕਰੇ ਪ੍ਹਾਰਾ ॥ ਸਕਲ ਬਿਧੁੰਸ ਜੱਗ ਕਰ ਡਾਰਾ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Tin Dare Prahaaraa|| Sakal Bidhouns Jagg Kardaaraa||17||
translation: With blows of various types, he destroyed the merit of the whole Yajna (sacrifice).17.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਤ ਭਾਂਤ ਤਨ ਭੂਪ ਸੰਘਾਰੇ ॥ ੲਿਕ ੲਿਕ ਤੇ ਕਰ ਦੁੲਿ ਦੁੲਿ ਡਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Tan Bhoop Sanhdare|| Ik Ik Te Kar Due Due Ddare||
translation: He destroyed many kings and chopped their bodies into bits.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਕਹੁ ਪਹੁਚ ਤ੍ਰਿਸੂਲ ਪ੍ਹਾਰਾ ॥ ਤਾ ਕਹੁ ਮਾਰ ਠੳੁਰ ਹੀ ਡਾਰਾ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Jaakauh Pahouch Trisool Prahaaraa|| Taa Kauh Maar Thaur Hidaaraa||18||
translation: On whomsoever the blow of the trident struck, he died there and then.18.

gurmukhi: ਜੱਗ ਕੁੰਡ ਨਿਰਖਤ ਭਯੋ ਜਬ ਹੀ ॥ ਜੂਟ ਜਟਾਨ ੳੁਖਾਰਸ ਤਬ ਹੀ ॥
transliteration: Jagg Kound Nirkhat Bhayo Jab Hee|| Jeet Jataan Oukhaaras Tab Hee||
translation: When Shiva looked into the sacrificial pit and saw he burnt body of Gauri, he began to pluck his matted hair.

gurmukhi: ਬੀਰ ਭਦ੍ਰ ਤਬ ਕੀਅਾ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਸਾ ॥ ੳੁਪਜਤ ਕਰੋ ਨਰੇਸਨ ਨਾਸਾ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Beer Bhadra Tab Keedaa Prakaasaa|| Oupjat Daro Daresan Naasaa||19||
translation: At that time, Virbhandra manifested himself there and after his manifestation, he began to destroy the kings.19.

gurmukhi: ਕੇਤਕ ਕਰੇ ਦੁਖੰਡ ਨ੍ਰਿਪਤ ਬਰ ॥ ਕੇਤਕ ਪਠੈ ਦੲੇ ਜਮ ਕੇ ਘਰ ॥
transliteration: Ketak Dare Doukhanndnripat Bar|| Ketak Padhhaidae Jam Ke Ghar||
translation: He chopped several kings into part and sent several of them to the abode of Yama.

gurmukhi: ਕੇਤਕ ਗਿਰੇ ਧਰਣ ਬਿਕਰਾਰਾ ॥ ਜਨ ਸਰਤਾ ਕੇ ਗਿਰੇ ਕਨਾਰਾ ॥੨੦॥
transliteration: Ketak Gire Dharan Bikraaraa|| Jan Sarta Ke Gire Kanaaraa||20||
translation: Just as with the flooding of the stream, the banks are eroded further, likewise many terrible warriors began to fall on the earth.20.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਲੳੁ ਸਿਵਹ ਚੇਤਨਾ ਅਾੲੀ ॥ ਗਹਿ ਪਿਨਾਕ ਕਹੁ ਪਰੋ ਰਿਸਾੲੀ ॥
transliteration: Tab Lau Sivah Chetnaa Aaee|| Gad(i) Pinaak Kauh Daro Risaaee||
translation: At that time, Shiva regained his senses and fell on the enemy with his bow in his hand.

gurmukhi: ਜਾ ਕੇ ਤਾਣ ਬਾਣ ਤਨ ਮਾਰਾ ॥ ਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਤਜੇ ਤਿਨ ਪਾਨਨੁਚਾਰਾ ॥੨੧॥
transliteration: Jaa Ke Taan Baan Tan Maaraa|| Praan Taje Tin Paanan(u) Chaaraa||21
translation: Whomsoever Shiva struck his arrow by pulling his bow, he breathed his last there and then.21.
